curated_text: Symbol: MDLZ. Year: 2024. Period: Q3. ReportType: Q10. Section: Competition and Market Position. This section discusses competitors, market dynamics, and regulatory landscape.  Competitors mentioned: the European Economic Area, the European Commission, the European Union, Third-Party Guarantees, Mondelēz International, Mondelēz International: Balance, EPS, Diluted, AMEA, Basis of Presentation, Plant and Equipment, Restructuring Program, Financial Instruments, AMEA Europe North America Total, Biscuits & Baked Snacks, Gum & Candy, Management’s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition, Overview of Business and Strategy, Significant Items Affecting Comparability, Commodity Trends, Basis of Presentation - War, Items Affecting Comparability of Financial Results, Hamas, Organic Net Revenue, MD&A, • Organic Net Revenue, Developed Markets, Halls, Perfetti Van Melle Group, KDP, the Organization of Economic Cooperation and Development’s, Non-GAAP Financial Measures, Consolidated Results of Operations, Financial Measures, • Diluted EPS, Adjusted EPS, the Consolidated Results of Operations, Basis of Presentation – War, Chinese yuan, Grow Program, Key Drivers, Adjusted Operating Income, Acquisitions and Divestitures, Mondelēz International, Board of Directors, DIV, Contingencies, Mondelez International Holdings Netherlands B.V.. Context excerpt: competition law through certain practices allegedly restricting cross-border trade within the European Economic Area. On January 28, 2021, the European Commission announced it had taken the next procedural step in its investigation and opened formal proceedings. As previously disclosed, we have been cooperating with the investigation in an effort to reach a negotiated resolution in this matter. In the fourth quarter of 2022, we had accrued (in accordance with U.S. GAAP), on a pre-tax basis, a liability of € 300 million ($ 321 million) within other current liabilities in the consolidated balance sheet and selling, general and administrative expenses in the consolidated statement of earnings as an estimate of the possible cost to resolve this matter. During the fourth quarter of 2023, we determined that we are likely to achieve a resolution with the European Commission that is expected to result in a liability of approximately € 340 million ($ 375 million) in total. We have adjusted our
